title: Japan's new star Kenki Fukuoka prepared to turn back on rugby to concentrate on medical career
text:
For jet-heeled Japan wing Kenki Fukuoka it is not simply a case of catch him if you can but catch him while you can. Sunday’s quarter-final against South Africa, where he will line up opposite South Africa’s Cheslin Kolbe, may represent the last game before he retires from Brave Blossoms.

It seems incredible that Fukuoka, clearly one of the players of the tournament, is prepared to walk away from the international game. At just 27, he has resolved to attend medical school to continue the family tradition of becoming a doctor.
